IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON PROVIDES SECONDARY SCHOOL EDUCATION, ENGAGING THE INTELLECT, COMPASSION, AND TALENTS OF OUR STUDENTS, EMPOWERING THEM TO ACT WITH HUMANITY AND PURPOSE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON PROVIDES SECONDARY SCHOOL EDUCATION, ENGAGING THE INTELLECT, COMPASSION, AND TALENTS OF OUR STUDENTS, EMPOWERING THEM TO ACT WITH HUMANITY AND PURPOSE.
IRS990.Desc: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL (NMH) GIVES YOUNG PEOPLE AN EXCEPTIONAL ACADEMIC EXPERIENCE TAUGHT BY EXPERT, CARING FACULTY. NMH IS A SECULAR COED BOARDING AND DAY SCHOOL FOR 651 STUDENTS IN GRADES NINE THROUGH TWELVE AND POST GRADUATE. OUR BEAUTIFUL WOODED CAMPUS BORDERS THE CONNECTICUT RIVER IN WESTERN MASSACHUSETTS' PIONEER VALLEY. HERE, WE CHALLENGE STUDENTS TO THINK CRITICALLY AND TO CHANNEL THEIR TALENTS TO DO GOOD IN THE WORLD, INSPIRING IN THEM A SENSE OF PURPOSE AT NMH, A CONSTELLATION OF ADULTS INTERACT WITH AND SUPPORT STUDENTS THROUGHOUT THE DAY. CLASSES ARE SMALL AND EXTENDED TO ALLOW STUDENTS TO EXPLORE EACH SUBJECT IN DEPTH. STUDENTS TAKE THREE MAJOR COURSES EACH SEMESTER FOR A TOTAL OF SIX CHALLENGING COLLEGE-PREPARATORY COURSES PER YEAR. THE SCHOOL OFFERS AN EXTENSIVE CHOICE OF SPORTS TEAMS, PERFORMING ARTS GROUPS, CLUBS AND STUDY-ABROAD OPTIONS. MORE THAN 200 STUDENTS VOLUNTEER EACH SEMESTER IN OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. STUDENTS HELP RUN OUR WORKING FARM, WHICH HAS BEEN IN OPERATION SINCE THE SCHOOL'S FOUNDING IN 1879.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL (NMH) SUMMER SESSION OFFERS PROGRAMS FOR STUDENTS WISHING TO ENRICH, SUPPLEMENT, OR ACCELERATE THEIR SCHOOL-YEAR EDUCATION. WE HAVE AN EXTENSIVE, COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM THAT HAS EXISTED IN VARIOUS FORMS FOR MORE THAN 100 YEARS. EACH SUMMER, WE GATHER AS A COMMUNITY TO ENGAGE IN ACADEMIC WORK AND TO LEARN FROM EACH OTHER IN MANY DIFFERENT WAYS. OUR STUDENT POPULATION IS DIVERSE AND WORLDLY -- IN THE SUMMER OF 2015, 30 DIFFERENT COUNTRIES AND 16 STATES WITHIN THE U.S. WERE REPRESENTED. OUR TALENTED FACULTY IS ASSISTED BY 35 TEACHING INTERNS TO PROVIDE AN OUTSTANDING EXPERIENCE FOR OUR STUDENTS. OUR GOAL, THROUGH ALL ASPECTS OF OUR COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM, IS TO PROVIDE A VALUABLE, LIFE-CHANGING EXPERIENCE FOR EACH STUDENT WHO JOINS US. FOR MANY STUDENTS, NMH SUMMER SESSION PROVIDES THEIR FIRST TASTE OF A RIGOROUS ACADEMIC EXPERIENCE AND CHALLENGES THEM TO A NEW LEVEL. OTHER STUDENTS COME FROM STRONG SCHOOLS AND USE THEIR SUMMER HERE AS AN OPPORTUNITY TO FURTHER BUILD ACADEMIC SKILLS, ADVANCE IN THEIR COURSEWORK AND PREPARE FOR COLLEGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL MAINTAINS AGENCY ACCOUNTS AND ACTS AS A FISCAL AGENT FOR THE FUNDS.

NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL'S ENDOWED FUNDS ARE INVESTED INTO PERPETUITY AND THE INCOME IS USED TO FUND ITS PROGRAMS. THE FUNDS ARE INVESTED FOR LONG TERM GROWTH SO THAT CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS OF STUDENTS WILL RECEIVE BENEFIT FROM THE FUNDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ORDER TO OBJECTIVELY ESTABLISH FINANCIAL NEED, NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL (NMH) SUBSCRIBES TO THE SERVICES OF THE SCHOOL SCHOLARSHIP SERVICE (SSS) WHICH PROVIDES A FINANCIAL AID NEED ANALYSIS BASED ON INFORMATION MADE AVAILABLE BY FAMILIES IN A CONFIDENTIAL STATEMENT KNOWN AS THE PFS -- PARENT FINANCIAL STATEMENT. BY APPLYING OBJECTIVE CRITERIA IN A SPECIFIC FORMULA, SSS IS ABLE TO HELP ESTABLISH A FAMILY'S ABILITY TO PAY THE EXPECTED PARENTAL CONTRIBUTION, WHICH IS THEN ADJUSTED FOR THE NUMBER OF OTHER FAMILY MEMBERS IN TUTION CHARGING INSTITUTIONS AND FOR DAY VERSUS BOARDING SITUATIONS. ONCE FINANCIAL NEED HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED, NMH WILL MAKE A FINANCIAL AID AWARD WHICH COMES AS CLOSE AS POSSIBLE TO MEETING THE INDICATED NEED.

HOUSING IS PROVIDED FOR OFFICERS, KEY EMPLOYEES AND HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER AND IS NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES. NON-TAXABLE BENEFITS (REPORTED IN SCHEDULE J, PART II, COLUMN D) FOR THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS INCLUDES HOUSING AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT FOR THE CONVENIENCE OF THE EMPLOYER: PETER FAYROIAN, $38,400; RICHARD T. WOOD, $24,318; ALLYSON GOODWIN, $15,695; JESSICA BIGGIE, $13,517; CLAUDE ANDERSON, $19,171; SHARON HOWELL, $15,255. SOCIAL CLUB DUES ARE PROVIDED FOR THE HEAD OF SCHOOL. USE OF THE SOCIAL CLUB IS FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES ONLY AND DUES ARE NOT INCLUDED IN TAXABLE WAGES.
DISCRETIONARY BONUSES ARE APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.
THE HEAD OF SCHOOL, PETER FAYROIAN, IS IN HIS INITIAL CONTRACT WITH THE SCHOOL.
2014 SERIES BONDS HEDGE PROVIDER: BANK OF NEW YORK REMAINING TERM: 8.25 HEDGE PROVIDER: MORGAN STANLEY REMAINING TERM: 18.25 HEDGE PROVIDER: MORGAN STANLEY REMAINING TERM: 26.25
OTHER SPENT PROCEEDS - REFUND OF PRIOR ISSUE
ORGANIZATIONAL POLICY TO NOT RECORD GIFT-IN-KIND DONATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ELLEN W. PAYZANT AND THOMAS W. PAYZANT HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ONCE NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL (NMH)'S FORM 990 IS COMPLETED, IT IS FIRST REVIEWED BY NMH'S INTERNAL MANAGEMENT. FOLLOWING THAT REVIEW, NMH'S INTERNAL MANAGEMENT AND OUTSIDE ADVISORS PRESENT THE FORM 990 (EXCLUDING SCHEDULE B) TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL REVIEWS SCHEDULE B WITH THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE COMPLETED FORM 990 (EXCLUDING SCHEDULE B) IS PROVIDED TO ALL BOARD MEMBERS PRIOR TO THE FORM BEING FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL (NMH) MAINTAINS A WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY REQUIRING DISCLOSURE OF RELEVANT FACTS THAT GIVE RISE TO A POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST. ANNUALLY, OFFICERS, KEY EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO ACKNOWLEDGE IN WRITING THAT THEY HAVE READ AND UNDERSTOOD THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. ADDITIONALLY, EACH OFFICER, KEY EMPLOYEE, AND BOARD MEMBER ACKNOWLEDGES WITH SIGNATURE THAT NO CONFLICT OF INTEREST EXISTS, OR PROVIDES DISCLOSURE OF A CONFLICT. THE FORMS ARE RETURNED TO THE CFO AND TREASURER. IF A CONFLICT EXISTS, THAT MEMBER MAY NOT BE PRESENT FOR DELIBERATIONS OR PARTICPATE IN DECISIONS FOR A TRANSACTION INVOLVING A CONFLICT OF INTEREST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL (NMH) HAS AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS COMMITTEE THAT REVIEWS ANNUALLY THE PERFORMANCE OF THE HEAD AND THE SENIOR STAFF BASED ON FEEDBACK SHARED FROM ALL INDEPENDENT TRUSTEES. DURING ITS REVIEW OF THAT FEEDBACK AND CONSIDERING AVAILABLE ANALYTICAL MARKET DATA, THE COMMITTEE SETS THE COMPENSATION OF THE HEAD OF SCHOOL FOR THE UPCOMING YEAR. AT THE FALL MEETING OF THE FULL BOARD, THE COMMITTEE GIVES AN ORAL REPORT OF ITS FINDINGS AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE HEAD IS RESPONSIBLE FOR SETTING THE COMPENSATION FOR THE SENIOR STAFF BASED ON COMPARABLE MARKET DATA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NORTHFIELD MOUNT HERMON SCHOOL'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
